subject: RE: [junit] Regarding JUnit TestSuite creation and execution
msgSnippet: Hi, simply write: public class CalculatorTests { public static Test suite() { TestSuite suite = new TestSuite( Test all functions of the Calculator class );
messageBody:
Hi,

simply write:

public class CalculatorTests {

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Test all functions of the Calculator class");
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite= new TestSuite(CalculatorTestAdd);
suite= new TestSuite(CalculatorTestSubtract);
suite= new TestSuite(CalculatorTestMultiply);
suite= new TestSuite(CalculatorTestDivide);
return suite;
}
}

In addition I would suggest you to name your test classes in
a more intent-revealing manner, by using the suffix Test.
For example name it CalculatorAddTest instead of CalculatorTestAdd.
So by developing more and more tests you are able to group your tests
by test domains, for example *ServiceTest, *ViewTest, *ProcessAdapterTest
etc.
Maybe you will create other add-tests and you got an *AddTest-domain ;-)

Regards
